title: Explain the static keyword in Java

answers.junior: static means the member belongs to the class, not to instances. You can access it without creating an object. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: static members are shared across all instances, loaded at class initialization time. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Includes variables, methods, blocks, and nested classes.
answers.senior: static members reside in metaspace, initialized once per classloader. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Static initialization order matters, and static blocks execute during class loading.
answers.tricky: Discuss static initialization order, classloader implications, memory leaks with static collections, and thread safety of static variables. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
